metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19319 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.2, a setxattr operation, after a mount of a crafted ext4 image, can cause a slab-out-of-bounds write access because of an ext4_xattr_set_entry use-after-free in fs/ext4/xattr.c when a large old_size value is used in a memset call, aka CID-345c0dbf3a30. It was discovered that the ext4 file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle setxattr operations in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1073-aws - 4.4.0-1073.77
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> Exploiting this vulnerability requires a crafted filesystem image to be mounted sbeattie> it's asserted by Jan Kara in the suse bug below that 345c0dbf3a30 (plus related commits) addresses the issue

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1073.77').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-184.214~14.04.1').
